metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39319 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing input length validation in the `urbdrc` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> malicious server could cause client to crash

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
